page.title: 14Haverfordwest Fairs
page.content: Granted by Royal Family to encourage free trade. Earliest in H'west thought to be in the 1100's when Cardoc discovered healing waters in Merlins Bridge, fairs grew around the April gathering. Three fairs granted by William & Mary in 1695,an October fair to coincide with harvest celebrations and two livestock fairs one on the second Tuesday of each month & a pig fair on the following day.The latter have become livestock markets.The October fair,the hiring fair,is still held on the 5th & is known as Portfield fair. It was moved from Portfield in 1838 to S.T. Thomas's Green in the reign of James 1st, May Fair was granted & is held on S.T.Thomas's Green on first Tuesday in May.These fairs are now only fun fairs;trade & hiring finished long ago.
